alert.note: Alert for Wayne (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 23 at 4:58PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF WAYNE COUNTY THROUGH 530 PM EDT... At 458 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near Hagerstown, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Richmond, Centerville, Cambridge City, Hagerstown, Fountain City, Dublin, Franklin, Greens Fork, East Germantown, Economy, Mount Auburn, Jacksonburg, Interstate 70 at Exit 145 and Williamsburg. This includes I-70 in Indiana between mile markers 134 and 148. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
